author: Harsh Trivedi
title: Noida to go cleaner & greener as authority plans to appoint consultant to enhance sustainability | Delhi News - News9live
text: Noida: In a major announcement the Noida Authority has revealed its plans to hire a consultant to develop an integrated, sustainable, and environmentally friendly sanitation system in the NCR city. As per the reported information, this initiative aligns with the objectives of the Swachh Bharat Mission, the Indian government's long-run flagship cleanliness program. If sources are to be believed, to maintain a clean and green city, the consultant will review current sanitation practices and provide technical support and advisory services. This additionally includes assistance with procurement, document preparation, MIS report generation, and field support, as needed, to achieve the mission's goals. “We need to streamline the system to make the city clean and beautiful under the Swachh Bharat Mission. The consultant will help the authority perform better in all matters related to sanitation. We need to adopt the best practices to achieve better results,” said Lokesh M, Chief Executive Officer of the Noida Authority. Interested consultants have until July 24 to submit their applications, after which tenders will be opened, according to officials. What will the consultant look after? The consultant’s role will encompass advisory services for Swachh Survekshan (cleanliness survey), ODF+, ODF++, Water+, and the attainment of the "garbage free city" tag and star rating. They will also develop both short- and long-term plans to meet the Swachh Bharat Mission's objectives. “The consultant will create a time-bound action plan for implementing projects related to solid waste management, sanitation, and other activities supporting the mission,” the tender terms state. An aim to improve Noida’s ranking in the Swachh Vayu Survekshan Technical advisory services provided by the consultant will include monitoring, supervising, and executing the Swachh Bharat Mission. The agency will also assist the authority in measures to enhance air quality under the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) and help improve Noida’s ranking in the Swachh Vayu Survekshan (clean air survey), a new initiative by the Ministry of Environment, Forest, and Climate Change (MoEFCC). Capacity-building programs, workshops, and seminars for Noida Authority staff Additionally, the consultant will organise capacity-building programs, workshops, and seminars for Noida Authority staff. They will also prepare procurement documents for dump site management, debris management, waste disposal, road washing and sweeping, bio-methanisation facilities, and air quality improvement measures. These areas will be managed either departmentally, outsourced, or through public-private partnership (PPP) mode. Public grievances and complaint redressal The agency will assist the Noida Authority in appointing consultants or service providers to select appropriate technologies for municipal solid waste management via public procurement processes. They will also design policies for public grievances and complaint redressal and recommend best practices to address gaps in the current solid waste management system. The consultant will be engaged for two years from the contract signing date, with a provision for a one-year extension based on satisfactory performance and mutual agreement.
